solution_line_template: First divide {total_chapters} by {divisor}, ignoring the remainder, to find how many chapters in the book are divisible by {divisor}: {total_chapters} / {divisor} = 10.33..., which means {chapters_divisible_by_3} chapters are divisible by {divisor}

Then subtract that number from the total number of chapters to find how many chapters she reads: {total_chapters} chapters - {chapters_divisible_by_3} chapters = <<{total_chapters}-{chapters_divisible_by_3}={chapters_read}>>{chapters_read} chapters

Then multiply the number chapters by the time to read each chapter to find the total time she spends reading: {chapters_read} chapters * {minutes_per_chapter} minutes/chapter = <<{chapters_read}*{minutes_per_chapter}={total_minutes_reading}>>{total_minutes_reading} minutes

Then divide that time by the number of minutes per movie to find the total time spent reading in hours: {total_minutes_reading} minutes / {minutes_per_hour} minutes/hour = <<{total_minutes_reading}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_hours_reading}>>{total_hours_reading} hours
